alert.note: Alert for Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:01PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR LEES FERRY THROUGH 430 PM MST... At 400 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marble Canyon, or 13 miles southwest of Page, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts ranging from 40-45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, LeChee, Marble Canyon, Lees Ferry, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Wahweap, Antelope Creek Basin, and Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 527 and 556. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 526 and 550. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
